alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 11:54AM EDT until April 13 at 11:36AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg and Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River at Mount Carmel. .Minor flooding of lowland areas continues on the White River at both Petersburg and Hazleton...and on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel. Both rivers have crested and will continue to fall through this week amid dry weather. Flooding is expected to end on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel Tuesday....while ending on the White River at Petersburg late Wednesday...and at Hazleton Friday. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Low bottomlands flood and flooding begins on higher bottomlands. State Road 257 may begin to flood if Shoals gage reading is over 17 feet. Private levees may be overtopped in many cases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Monday /10:30 AM CDT Monday/ the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Monday /10:30 AM CDT Monday/ was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening and continue falling to 6.2 feet Thursday, April 20. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated late this evening.
